history.content:
Why can't you take more CS courses? Are you data science?

——————

Definitely! With those classes, you’ve written a thousand line+ project from scratch(61B), worked with api’s and data (data 100), plus know enough algorithms to pass any interview (61B+170). Now with that being said, it’s hard for anyone to get a job at google, but you definitely can, especially if you pair that with internship experience/personal projects!! Maybe 61c and 162 would be the last classes you really need to make yourself more competent, especially for backend positions. 


Definitely reach out to the career center for job applying advice!
Why can't you take more CS courses? Are you data science?

children.subject: I'm just gonna point out to whoever answered: really, that's none of your business. OP asked a question, and if you don't have an answer, then don't post in the box that is clearly labeled for 'student answer'. Now the post is resolved, and the chances of someone giving a real answer have dropped significantly. This is basic Piazza etiquette...

Ya I think so :) Here are some tips to have a great shot at Google, whenever you decide to apply:

1. Make your resume/LinkedIn well designed with ton of cool content. This takes a lot of steps, i'm happy to help if you wanna email me, but utilize career center, Internet, and friends.

2. Interview Prep. I personally started with Cracking Coding Interview, then Leetcode and Hackerrank. I personally do interviews in Java, I think lots of people do Python as well.

3. Referrals are cool, and you go to Cal, so plenty of alumni and friends probably working at Google or will eventually :) Go to their info sessions and check them out at Career Fairs. Even if you don't get accepted today, you definitely could in the future.

4. Don't neglect behavior Qs! I think being a nice person is just a great ROI for life.

5. Continue taking CS courses you're interested in, try to build some side projects and improve your coding skills(skills meaning you can improve them, you're not born a CS beast and there is no plateau).

Taking more CS courses can help you gain knowledge in many ways, which as a result, would help you. With that being said, I feel 61B material is more than enough! Other classes might be useful for particular specializations like ML(Taking 61B would not be enough for ML Engineering job for most positions, i'd imagine).

history.content: Would I be able to get a software job at big companies such as Google if I only take CS 61B, CS 70, DATA 100, and CS 170? Would big recruiters find me competent for software engineering positions?
history.subject: Software Engineer Question
